intro: Barbarea vulgaris var. praecox, commonly known as early wintercress, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lobed and alternate, often with a slightly succulent texture. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in gardens, wastelands, and along roadsides.
